q: A man walks into a bar and asks the barman for a glass of water. The barman pulls out a gun and points it at the man. The man says 'Thank you' and walks out. Why?
a: The man had the hiccups. The gun scared them out of him.

q: A man lives on the 10th floor. Every day he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work. When he comes back, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs to the 10th. Unless it's raining. Why?
a: The man is very short. He can't reach the button for the 10th floor, only the 7th. When it rains, he has his umbrella to push the button.

q: A woman shoots her husband. Then she holds him under water for over 5 minutes. Finally, she hangs him. But 5 minutes later they both go out together and enjoy a wonderful dinner together. How can this be?
a: She is a photographer. She took a picture of him, developed it, and hung it up to dry.

q: Five pieces of coal, a carrot and a scarf are lying on the lawn. Nobody put them on the lawn but there is a perfectly logical reason why they should be there. What is it?
a: They were used by children who built a snowman. The snow has now melted.

q: A man pushes his car to a hotel and tells the owner he's bankrupt. Why?
a: He is playing Monopoly.

q: A man is looking at a picture of someone. His friend asks who it is. The man replies, 'Brothers and sisters, I have none. But that man's father is my father's son.' Who is in the picture?
a: His son.

q: A man rode into town on Friday. He stayed for three nights and then left on Friday. How is this possible?
a: His horse's name is Friday.

q: There are three switches downstairs. Each corresponds to one of three light bulbs upstairs. You can only go upstairs once. How do you determine which switch controls which bulb?
a: Turn on switch 1 for a few minutes, then turn it off and turn on switch 2. Go upstairs. The hot bulb is switch 1, the lit bulb is switch 2, and the cold dark bulb is switch 3.

q: A woman is sitting in her hotel room when there's a knock at the door. She opens it to find a man she's never seen before. He says 'Oh I'm sorry, I thought this was my room' and walks away. The woman immediately calls security. Why?
a: You don't knock on your own hotel room door. He was clearly lying and probably trying to see if the room was occupied before breaking in.

q: Two fathers and two sons went fishing. Each caught one fish, but only three fish were caught. How is this possible?
a: There were only three people: a grandfather, his son, and his grandson. The son is both a father and a son.

q: A man is found dead in a field. Next to him is an unopened package. There are no other creatures in the field. How did he die?
a: The package was a parachute that didn't open.

q: A man was walking home from work when it started to rain. He had no umbrella, no hat, nothing to cover his head. When he got home, not a single hair on his head was wet. How?
a: He was bald.

q: A windowless building has 10 floors. A dead man is found in an elevator between the 5th and 6th floors. There is nothing but a puddle of water beneath him. How did he die?
a: He was an ice cube that melted. (Alternative: He was carrying an ice block to keep cool during a heat wave.)

q: A man lives in a house with four walls. All the walls face south. A bear walks past the house. What color is the bear?
a: White. The only place where all walls can face south is the North Pole, so it must be a polar bear.

q: There's a dead man in the middle of a desert. He's naked. He's holding a straw. How did he die?
a: He was in a hot air balloon that was going down. They drew straws to see who would jump to lighten the load. He lost.

q: A man was born in 1955. Today is his 30th birthday. How is this possible?
a: He was born in hospital room 1955.

q: A man dies and goes to heaven. There are thousands of other people there. They are all naked and look as they did at age 21. He looks around to see if there is anyone he recognizes. He sees a couple and immediately knows they are Adam and Eve. How?
a: They don't have belly buttons because they weren't born—they were created.

q: A horse jumps over a castle, and the castle disappears. How is this possible?
a: It's a chess game. The knight (horse) takes the rook (castle).

q: A woman wakes up every morning, walks to her window, and looks outside. Then she screams. Why?
a: She's a lighthouse keeper. The light went out and a ship crashed.

q: A man is found dead in a desert, holding half of a matchstick. What happened?
a: He and others were in a hot air balloon that was going down. They drew matches to see who would jump out. He got the short match.

q: A man walks into a restaurant. He orders albatross soup. After one sip he goes outside and kills himself. Why?
a: He was shipwrecked years ago. His friend died. He was given 'albatross soup' but it tasted different. Now he realizes it wasn't albatross—it was his friend.

q: There is a dead body lying in the desert next to a rock. How did the person die?
a: It was Superman and the rock was kryptonite.

q: A man is lying dead in a room. There is a large pile of gold and jewels on the floor, a chandelier attached to the ceiling, and a large open window. How did he die?
a: He was Aladdin. The room is in the cave. The lamp (chandelier) let out the genie who granted his wish, but the cave collapsed.

q: A body is found in a park in Chicago in the middle of summer. It has a fractured skull and many other broken bones, but the cause of death was hypothermia. How?
a: The person was a stowaway in a plane's wheel well. They froze during flight and fell out when the landing gear opened.

q: A man is found dead in an alley. He is lying next to a motorcycle. He died before the motorcycle accident. How?
a: He was killed by a sword. He was in a jousting competition.

q: A healthy person checks into a hospital. The doctor gives them 2 pills and a glass of water. The person dies. Why?
a: The person was an actor rehearsing a death scene. The pills were props, but the glass contained real poison by mistake.

q: A man hears his favorite song on the radio. He kills himself. Why?
a: He was a DJ who recorded a show as an alibi while he committed a crime. Hearing it live means the police will know.

q: A woman walks into a hardware store and asks the clerk how much a certain item costs. He replies '$3 for one, $6 for 50, and $9 for 144.' What is she buying?
a: House numbers. Each digit costs $3.

q: A man is running home. He sees a masked man waiting for him. The man turns around and runs back to where he started. Why?
a: He is playing baseball. The masked man is the catcher. Home is home plate.

q: A man enters an art gallery and ruins a very expensive painting. Nobody tries to stop him. Why?
a: He is the artist and he's making changes to his own work.

q: A man is sitting at a bar enjoying a drink. He suddenly looks at his watch, pulls out a gun, and shoots himself. Why?
a: He was playing Russian roulette on a timer with friends.

q: A woman lives alone in a remote cabin. She has been without power for 3 days. What does she do for light?
a: It's daytime. The sun provides all the light she needs.

q: A man is driving alone in his car. He turns on the radio, listens for 5 minutes, turns around, goes home and shoots himself. Why?
a: He's a DJ who recorded his show as an alibi while committing a crime. Hearing it on the radio means his alibi is worthless.

q: A blind man walks into a store. He picks up a can, reads the label with his fingers, and puts it back. Then he leaves without buying anything. What happened?
a: The can had a Braille label, but someone had turned it upside down.

q: A man builds a rectangular house. Each side has a southern exposure. A bear walks by. What color is it?
a: White. The house is at the North Pole (all sides face south), so it's a polar bear.

q: A rooster lays an egg on top of a barn roof. Which way does it roll?
a: Roosters don't lay eggs.

q: How far can a dog run into the woods?
a: Halfway. After that, it's running out of the woods.

q: A woman has two coins that add up to 30 cents. One is not a nickel. What are the coins?
a: A quarter and a nickel. ONE is not a nickel—the other one is.

q: If you have a bowl with 6 apples and you take away 4, how many do you have?
a: 4. You took them, so you have 4.

q: A truck driver goes the wrong way down a one-way street. He passes 4 police cars but isn't stopped. Why?
a: He's walking, not driving.

q: A boat full of people leaves the dock, but not a single person is on the boat when it arrives. How?
a: Everyone on board is married—no single people.

q: A man calls his dog from the opposite side of the river. The dog crosses the river without getting wet and without using a bridge or boat. How?
a: The river was frozen.

q: A woman is pushing her car. She stops at a hotel and immediately knows she's bankrupt. Why?
a: She's playing Monopoly.

q: In a cabin in the woods, all the people inside are dead. The windows are intact, the doors are locked. There's no sign of foul play. What happened?
a: It's an airplane cabin that crashed.

q: A man wearing black clothes, black shoes and a black mask is crossing a road. There are no street lights, no moon, no stars. A car without headlights approaches, but stops in time. How?
a: It's daytime.

q: There are two plastic jugs filled with water. How could you put all of this water into a barrel, without using the jugs or any other containers, and still tell which water came from which jug?
a: Freeze the water in the jugs first, then put the ice blocks in the barrel.

q: A woman gives birth to two sons who are born on the same hour of the same day of the same year, but they are not twins. How?
a: They are triplets (or more)—she gave birth to at least three children.

q: A man was found murdered on Sunday morning. The wife called the police, who found these alibis: The wife was sleeping. The cook was making breakfast. The gardener was watering plants. The maid was getting the mail. The butler was cleaning the closet. Who did it?
a: The maid. There's no mail delivery on Sunday.

q: A grandfather, two fathers, and two sons go to the movies together. Each buys one ticket. How many tickets did they buy in total?
a: 3 tickets. The grandfather is a father, and his son is also a father.

q: A man lives on the 12th floor of an apartment building. Every morning he takes the elevator down to the lobby and leaves the building. At night, he gets into the elevator, and, if there is someone else in the elevator, he goes back to his floor directly. Otherwise, he goes to the 10th floor and walks up two flights of stairs to his apartment. Why?
a: He is too short to reach the button for the 12th floor. He can reach it if someone else is there to push it for him.

q: A woman enters a large metal box. She dies a few minutes later. How?
a: She went into an elevator and it fell, crashing at the bottom.

q: A man goes to a party and drinks some punch. He leaves early. Everyone else who drank the punch dies. Why did he survive?
a: The poison was in the ice. He drank before the ice melted.

q: A man takes an elevator to the 5th floor office every day. He works until 6 PM, then gets in the elevator and presses 1. The elevator starts going up. Why?
a: Someone on a higher floor called the elevator first.

q: Two men are in a desert. They both have backpacks on. One is dead, the other alive. The dead man's pack is closed. The living man's pack is open. What's in the pack?
a: A parachute. The dead man's didn't open.

q: A man is found dead in a locked room. There's a puddle of water and broken glass on the floor. What happened?
a: He was a goldfish in a bowl. The bowl fell and shattered.

q: A man and woman are found dead in a cabin in the mountains. There are no wounds, no signs of struggle. How did they die?
a: It's an airplane cabin. The plane crashed into the mountain.

q: A woman recognized her brother in a crowd even though she hadn't seen him in 20 years and he looked completely different. She had no photos and had never seen him as an adult. How?
a: They were twins. She looked in the mirror every day.

q: A woman buys a new pair of shoes. She goes to work, and at the end of the day, she is dead. What happened?
a: She was a tight-rope walker in a circus. Her new shoes were the wrong size and made her lose her balance.

q: A man is playing chess alone. He moves, and yells 'Checkmate!' Who lost?
a: He is solving a chess puzzle or studying a famous game.

q: A woman walked into a room and found her husband dead. There were 53 bicycles in the room. What happened?
a: Bicycles is a brand of playing cards. He was cheating at poker and got caught.

q: A man is found dead hanging from a rope tied to a rafter. There's a puddle of water beneath him but nothing else in the room. How did he kill himself?
a: He stood on a block of ice. When it melted, he hanged.

q: A man goes into a building. He rides a lift up but walks down the stairs. He is not exercising. Why?
a: He is a window washer who starts at the top and works his way down.

q: A woman calls her husband at work to say she's about to drink poison and there's nothing he can do. He rushes home but she's fine. What's going on?
a: They had a fight. She wanted to make him worry but never intended to actually drink poison.

q: A man was shot in the heart. He didn't have any medical assistance yet he survived. How?
a: He had an artificial heart (or he was shot with a camera).

q: A woman enters a library and runs towards a shelf. She grabs a book and runs outside. No one stops her. The alarm doesn't go off. She didn't check out the book. What happened?
a: She's a librarian putting a returned book back on the shelf after running late.

q: A man enters a bar. He orders a drink. The bartender pours gasoline in a glass and sets it on fire. The man drinks it. Why?
a: It's a flaming shot like a 'Flaming Dr Pepper' that you drink quickly after the flame is blown out.

q: A man leaves home, goes straight ahead, makes 3 left turns, and ends up back home facing 2 masked men. Where is he?
a: He's playing baseball. The masked men are the catcher and umpire.

q: A girl enters a shop and buys 100 candles. She pays with exact change and leaves. The shopkeeper calls the police. Why?
a: The money was counterfeit.

q: A king has two sons. One is honest and one always lies. The king wants the honest son to inherit. He asks them both the same question to determine which is which. What does he ask?
a: 'Are you the one who always lies?' The liar will say yes, the honest one will say no.

q: Three men are lined up. The first can see the other two. The second can see the third. The third sees no one. They're told there are 3 black hats and 2 white hats. Each gets a hat. The first and second say 'I don't know what color my hat is.' The third, who is blind, correctly states his hat color. How?
a: If man 1 saw two white hats, he'd know his was black. He didn't, so there's at least one black ahead. If man 2 saw a white hat and knew man 1 wasn't sure, he'd know his own was black. He didn't, so man 3 knows his is black.

q: A man was found murdered in his office. The suspects are Ann, Chris, Jason, and Laura. A calendar found near the body read '4, 11, 11, 5.' Who did it?
a: Jason. The numbers represent months: April (4), November (11), November (11), May (5) = J, A, S, O, N.

q: A woman buys rice in a store, then walks out without paying. The owner watches but says nothing. Why?
a: She's the owner.

q: A man enters a room and presses a button. A few seconds later, he dies. What happened?
a: He was in an elevator that plummeted when he pressed the button.

q: There's a round house. A woman is murdered inside. The maid said she was dusting corners. The chef said he was making dinner. The gardener said he was watering plants. Who's lying?
a: The maid. A round house has no corners.

q: A man orders pizza. When the delivery person arrives, the man opens the door and the delivery person immediately punches him. Why?
a: The pizza was late and free if delivered after 30 minutes. The man kept ordering and calling in false addresses to get free pizza.

q: A woman throws something out a window and dies. What did she throw?
a: A boomerang.

q: A man is lying in a field. Next to him is a sealed package. He didn't kill himself and no one else was around. How did he die?
a: His parachute didn't open.

q: A man is running toward the north pole at 10 mph. A wind is blowing 5 mph toward the south. If he drops a cigarette, in which direction will the smoke go?
a: Smoke rises. Also, you can't smoke in a no-smoking area (most races).

q: A man was going to marry a princess. But she decided to give him a test. She said she'd flip a coin, and he had to guess heads or tails. If he was right, she'd marry him. He lost but still married her. How?
a: She used a double-headed coin. He guessed tails to prove she was cheating. She was impressed by his cleverness.

q: A woman was at her mother's funeral. She met a man she'd never seen before and fell instantly in love. She didn't get his name or number. A few weeks later, she killed her sister. Why?
a: She hoped the man would come to another funeral. (This is a test for psychopaths—don't worry if you didn't get it!)

q: A man walks into a bar and asks for water. The bartender pulls out a shotgun. The man thanks him and leaves. Why?
a: The man had hiccups. The surprise cured him.

q: An antique dealer buys an old lamp at a flea market for $5. Later, a museum offers him $500,000 for it. He refuses. Why?
a: The lamp contained a genie that granted wishes. He wished for more than money.

q: A man dies at home every day but is alive every night. How?
a: He's an actor who plays a character that dies in a soap opera.

q: A man eats at a restaurant every day. One day the waiter gives him a different meal. After eating, the man kills himself. Why?
a: He was blind and always ordered the same meal to avoid mistakes. The different meal made him realize he'd been lied to (likely about the death of a loved one).

q: A woman wakes up. She turns on the TV and sees a report of a plane crash that killed 200 people. She screams and kills herself. Why?
a: Her husband was supposed to be on that plane. She had sabotaged it for insurance money.
